name: game-development-pack
description: Skills for Unity, Unreal Engine, and Godot game development including scripting, performance optimization, shader development, and build pipelines
author: CoWork-OSS
tryAsking: Set up a Unity project with a third-person character controller
Create an Unreal Blueprint for an inventory system with drag-and-drop
Write a GDScript for procedural terrain generation in Godot 4
Optimize draw calls and batching for mobile game performance
Design a shader for toon-style cel shading in Unity URP

skills.name: Unity Development
skills.description: Unity/C# scripting patterns, MonoBehaviour lifecycle, ScriptableObjects, URP/HDRP, and Unity CLI builds
skills.prompt:
Help with the following Unity development task.

Task: {{task}}

Consider:
1. C# scripting best practices (MonoBehaviour lifecycle, coroutines vs async)
2. ScriptableObjects for data-driven design
3. URP or HDRP rendering pipeline as appropriate
4. Physics (Rigidbody, Collider, Raycasting, layers)
5. UI Toolkit or uGUI for user interface
6. Addressables for asset management
7. Unity Test Framework for testing
8. Editor scripting for custom tools
9. Performance: object pooling, batching, LOD
10. Build command: Unity -batchmode -projectPath . -buildTarget <target> -executeMethod BuildScript.Build -quit

skills.name: Unreal Engine Development
skills.description: Unreal Engine C++/Blueprint patterns, Gameplay Framework, Niagara, Lumen/Nanite, and packaging
skills.prompt:
Help with the following Unreal Engine development task.

Task: {{task}}

Consider:
1. C++ and Blueprint interop (UCLASS, UPROPERTY, UFUNCTION macros)
2. Gameplay Framework (GameMode, PlayerController, Character, PlayerState)
3. Actor lifecycle (BeginPlay, Tick, EndPlay)
4. Enhanced Input System for player controls
5. Niagara for particle effects
6. Lumen (dynamic GI) and Nanite (virtualized geometry)
7. UMG for UI widgets
8. Replication for multiplayer
9. UnrealBuildTool and packaging
10. Automation testing framework

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: Unreal Engine development task or question

skills.name: Godot Development
skills.description: Godot 4 GDScript patterns, node tree architecture, signals, rendering, and export presets
skills.prompt:
Help with the following Godot development task.

Task: {{task}}

Consider:
1. GDScript patterns (typed variables, signals, @export, @onready)
2. Node tree architecture (scene composition, node inheritance)
3. Signals for decoupled communication
4. Physics (CharacterBody2D/3D, RigidBody, Area, raycasting)
5. Godot 4 rendering (Vulkan, Forward+, compatibility)
6. AnimationPlayer and AnimationTree
7. TileMap for 2D levels
8. Resource (.tres) and scene (.tscn) files
9. GDExtension for C++ performance
10. Export presets for platform targeting
11. Godot CLI: godot --headless --export-release <preset> <path>

skills.name: Game Performance Optimization
skills.description: Cross-engine performance optimization: draw calls, LOD, object pooling, GPU profiling, and memory management
skills.prompt:
Analyze and optimize game performance for the following scenario.

Scenario: {{scenario}}
Engine: {{engine}}

Please provide:
1. Draw call reduction strategies (batching, instancing, atlasing)
2. LOD (Level of Detail) configuration
3. Occlusion culling setup
4. Object pooling implementation
5. Memory budget analysis
6. GPU vs CPU bottleneck identification
7. Texture optimization (compression, mipmaps, streaming)
8. Shader optimization (reduce ALU, minimize branching)
9. Physics optimization (layer masks, simplified colliders)
10. Platform-specific recommendations (mobile vs PC vs console)
11. Profiling tool usage (Unity Profiler, Unreal Insights, Godot debugger)

parameters.name: scenario
parameters.description: Performance issue description (FPS target, bottleneck symptoms, scene complexity)

agentRoles.name: game-developer
agentRoles.description: Specializes in game engine development, scripting, performance optimization, and build pipelines for Unity, Unreal, and Godot
agentRoles.systemPrompt: You are a Game Developer agent. You excel at Unity (C#), Unreal Engine (C++/Blueprints), and Godot (GDScript/C#) development. You understand game-specific concerns: game loop architecture, physics systems, rendering pipelines, shader programming, asset management, build optimization, platform-specific deployment, multiplayer networking, and performance profiling. You use shell tools for build commands and engine CLI operations. You prioritize runtime performance and player experience.
